episodes.content: A store in Akihabara, Japan's biggest electronics town, sells over 100,000 electronics parts, including resistors, capacitors and circuit boards. Around 1,000 people come to the store every day, from professional engineers to people who like to build their own electronics for fun. Among the people we meet are a musician who makes his own effects units; a graduate student who makes drones to take a break from job hunting; and a man whose hobby of fixing car audio systems has turned into a job. For 3 days, we peeked inside the store to find out what it is people come to buy and what they hope to create with it.
episodes.description: In Akihabara, Japan's biggest electronics town, one store is famous for the wide range of electronics parts they carry - over 100,000 of them. What do people buy and what do they hope to make with it?
episodes.subtitle: Akihabara: Infatuated with Electronics
episodes.title: Document 72 Hours
